meanings.definition: A person who performs less well than expected, especially in academic or professional settings.
meanings.sent1: The underachiever struggled to keep up with the rest of the class.
meanings.sent2: She was labeled as an underachiever because her grades were lower than anticipated.
meanings.sent3: The underachiever's report card was a collection of disappointments.
meanings.sent4: In a sea of high achievers, he felt like a lone underachiever adrift.
meanings.sent5: The underachiever's lackluster performance stood out like a sore thumb.

meanings.definition: To perform less well than expected, especially in academic or professional settings.
meanings.sent1: Despite his potential, he continued to underachieve in his studies.
meanings.sent2: She tends to underachieve when she doesn't put in enough effort.
meanings.sent3: The student managed to underachieve even with all the resources available to him.
meanings.sent4: Her lack of motivation caused her to consistently underachieve in her job.
meanings.sent5: The team knew they would underachieve if they didn't work together effectively.
